reviewText: A Christmas Visitor takes you into the story. The acting is done very natural. It could be very sad for someone to watch around Christmas that has lost a loved one in combat which would already be having a hard time. It can also give hope for someone thinking they may have cancer or console someone who has lost a child or sibling in battle. I like it. The bonus movie, Angel in the family, is too far out there for me. I don't care for it, since it came as a bonus I'm not out anything.
summary: A Christmas Visitor is a touching story
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: This movie is excellent especially if you've lost a loved one.  It has made me feel much better even though nothing can replace a family member who has died.
summary: One of the best movies I've ever seen especially if you've lost a loved one.
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: very sweet movie but it does provoke tears.  you have to pay attention because the ending is what the movie is all about
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: Loved both of these movies, saw them on the Hallmark Channel and knew I wanted them for my home collection....very heartwarming. Loved them both.........
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: I found this to be a very nice story.  It might be a little too sad for some people. But for someone who has lost a loved one it might be very comforting. I've seen this shown on TV many times and thought it would be too sad but I'm glad I did buy and watch it.
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: This is an excellent movie when seen on Hallmark Channel because it is close captioned. I have bought several movies I thought were close captioned because I saw them on the Hallmark Channel. When I received the DVDs they were neither close captioned nor subtitled. What a disappointment.
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family

reviewText: I really enjoyed the movies but the picture was too blown up to fit my 37" TV screen.  I would of preferred the full screen ratio version better  even though it would not of filled the whole screen.  So if you have a wide screen TV 32" and above don't buy the ratio: 1:33.1 or it does look too blown up.  Again, the movie was really good.
Title: A Christmas Visitor Movie: Angel in the Family
